Key Match Events: Tyrese Haliburton and Pascal Siakam each scored 25 points
Indiana Pacers took control with a 17-2 second quarter run that turned a 30-29 deficit into a 46-31 lead
Golden State never led again but cut the halftime deficit to five and closed within three early in the third quarter
Pre-Game Insights: Golden State sat six players on their second game in two nights, including All-Star Stephen Curry, Draymond Green and Andrew Wiggins
Post-Match Reflections: Indiana has won all five games by 10 or more points
Haliburton has rediscovered his All-Star level
With the Pacers getting healthy, their depth is helping, too
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pacers struggled to score in the paint in the first half, but finished the game with a 54-46 scoring advantage inside
